revised_title: Penicillin's Evolution: Inhibitors as a Strategy to Combat Resistance
tldr: This article discusses the development of inhibitors to combat the resistance of bacteria to penicillin and other beta-lactam antibiotics. It explores the discovery of new types of beta-lactamase inhibitors, such as clavulanic acid and olivanic acids, and their potential to enhance the efficacy of existing antibiotics. The article also highlights the challenges in finding effective inhibitors and the need for continued research in this area.
